data.title: Macy Cook - Softball

	The American Defensive Player of the Year
	American Athletic Conference Honor Roll Selection (4/22, 4/29)
	Started

11 Macy Cook

Position Catcher

Height 5-6

Class Senior

Highschool Lake HIgh School

Hometown Uniontown, Ohio

Prev School Wright State University

Bio

Related

Stats

Historical

Biography

2019 (Senior)

The American Defensive Player of the Year

American Athletic Conference Honor Roll Selection (4/22, 4/29)

Started in all 60 games of the season, one of just three players to start all 60

Recorded 43 hits including four doubles

Led the team in home runs with five including a grand slam for the conference opener against Tulsa (3/22)

Led the team in RBI with 42

Recorded 11 multi-hit games, two with three hits

Recorded 10 multi-RBI games, three with three RBI and two with four

Went on a seven-game hitting/reached base streak

Walked 20 times

Recorded 406 putouts at catcher, 18 assists

Recorded one double play

Caught seven runners stealing

2018 (Junior)

Appeared in 59 games, started 55

Recorded 292 putouts catching and 13 assists

Recorded 36 hits, 13 runs and 19 RBI with eight doubles and two home runs

Finished eight multi-hit games and four multi-RBI games

Put in play first hit at USF in the season opener against Illinois State

Went 2-for-3 against UNF with one double, one run and three RBI while catching a no-hitter

Went a perfect 2-for-2 against conference opponent UConn in the first conference game of the season with a USF single-game career high two doubles

Ranked third on the team in doubles with eight

Was named The American Player of the Week once (4/16)

2017 (Wright State):

Saw action in 52 games, mostly at catcher

Hit .326 with 43 hits in 132 at bats with 13 runs scored, five doubles and18 walks

First team All-Horizon League.

2016 (Wright State):

Saw action in 34 games, mostly at catcher

Hit .260 with 27 hits in 104 at bats with seven runs scored, five doubles, five multi-hit games and nine walks

High School:

First Team All-Federal League as a senior and a Second Team selection as a freshman, sophomore and junior

Team MVP and set school record for hits in a season as a senior

Hit .375 as a junior with 19 RBI, also earning team MVP honors

Hit .383 as a sophomore with 24 RBI

Hit .378 with 27 RBI as a freshman

Part of four state champions in travel ball and has competed in six national softball tournaments

Personal:

Born Macy Leigh Cook on February 15, 1997

Daughter of Joseph Cook and April Cook, has two sisters
